revised_title: A Detailed Study of the Human Tongue's Taste Organ
tldr: Augustus Waller examines the human tongue's taste organ in detail, focusing on the structure and function of taste papillae. He describes the fungiform and conical papillae, their blood vessels, and nerves, and observes the passage of blood globules in these structures. Waller also notes the differences in taste papillae between fetuses and adults.
